meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unattractive or shabby in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The dumpiness of the old house made it hard to sell.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed by the dumpiness of her worn-out shoes.
meanings.sent3: Despite its dumpiness, the little cafe had a cozy charm.
meanings.sent4: The dumpiness of the abandoned factory mirrored the town's decline.
meanings.sent5: The dumpiness of the alley was a stark reminder of neglect.

meanings.definition: A feeling of sadness or gloominess.
meanings.sent1: Her heart was heavy with dumpiness after the loss.
meanings.sent2: The dumpiness in the room was palpable after the bad news.
meanings.sent3: He tried to shake off the dumpiness by going for a walk.
meanings.sent4: The dumpiness in her voice revealed her inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The dumpiness of the rainy day matched his mood perfectly.

meanings.definition: To discard or dispose of something in a careless or hasty manner.
meanings.sent1: Please do not dumpiness your trash on the street.
meanings.sent2: He had to dumpiness the old furniture before moving.
meanings.sent3: She decided to dumpiness her old clothes to make space.
meanings.sent4: The company had to dumpiness excess stock to make room for new products.
meanings.sent5: He would often dumpiness his responsibilities onto others.
